c:attribute.name: state
c:attribute.description: The current state of the hub local alarm subsystem.

c:attribute.name: alarmState
c:attribute.description: The combined state of the alarm across all alerts.

c:attribute.name: securityMode
c:attribute.description: The state of the security alarm.

c:attribute.name: securityArmTime
c:attribute.description: The time at which the security system was or will be armed. This will be cleared when the security system is disarmed.

c:attribute.name: lastArmedTime
c:attribute.description: The last time the security alarm was armed.

c:attribute.name: lastArmedBy
c:attribute.description: The address of the last person to arm the security alarm, this may be empty if it was armed from a scene or a rule.

c:attribute.name: lastArmedFrom
c:attribute.description: The address of the keypad, rule, scene, or app the security alarm was armed from.

c:attribute.name: lastDisarmedTime
c:attribute.description: The last time at which the security system was disarmed.

c:attribute.name: lastDisarmedBy
c:attribute.description: The address of the last person to disarm the security alarm, this may be empty if it was disarmed from a scene or a rule.

c:attribute.name: lastDisarmedFrom

c:attribute.name: activeAlerts
c:attribute.description: A priority ordered list of alerts that are currently active. Note that the banner should always use the first element from this list, it is ordered.

c:attribute.name: availableAlerts
c:attribute.description: The set of alarms which are supported by the devices paired at the current place.

c:attribute.name: currentIncident
c:attribute.description: The currently incident, will be the empty string when there is no current incident.

c:attribute.name: reconnectReport
c:attribute.description: True if the report issued by the hub is due to a reconnect.

c:attribute.name: securityAlertState

c:attribute.name: securityDevices

c:attribute.name: securityExcludedDevices

c:attribute.name: securityActiveDevices

c:attribute.name: securityCurrentActive
c:attribute.description: The addresses of the devices that were initially active at arm time.

c:attribute.name: securityOfflineDevices
c:attribute.description: The addresses of the devices would be active except they have fallen offline.

c:attribute.name: securityTriggeredDevices
c:attribute.description: The addresses of the devices which are currently triggered.

c:attribute.name: securityTriggers
c:attribute.description: The triggers associated with the current alert.

c:attribute.name: securityPreAlertEndTime
c:attribute.description: The time at which the prealert time for the current incident expires.

c:attribute.name: securitySilent
c:attribute.description: When true only notifications will be sent, alert devices / keypads will not sound.

c:attribute.name: securityEntranceDelay
c:attribute.description:
The amount of time an alarm device must be triggering for before the alarm is fired for the current arming cycle..
Default: 30

c:attribute.name: securitySensitivity
c:attribute.description:
The number of alarm devices which must trigger before the alarm is fired for the current arming cycle.
Default: 1

c:method.name: Activate
c:method.description: Puts the hub local alarm into an 'active' state.

c:method.name: Suspend
c:method.description: Puts the subsystem into a 'suspended' state.

c:method.name: Arm
c:method.description: Attempts to arm the alarm into the requested mode, if successful it will return the delay until the alarm is armed. If this call is repeated with the alarm is in the process of arming with the same mode, it will return the remaining seconds until the alarm is armed (making retries safe). If this call is invoked with a new mode while the alarm is arming an error will be returned. If this call is invoked while the alarm is arming with bypassed devices it will return an error.

c:parameter.name: mode
c:parameter.description: The mode the alarm is being armed in

c:parameter.name: bypassed
c:parameter.description: True if arming in bypass mode

c:parameter.name: entranceDelaySecs
c:parameter.description:
The amount of time an alarm device must be triggering for before the alarm is fired.
Default: 30

c:parameter.name: exitDelaySecs
c:parameter.description:
The amount of time before the alarm is fully armed.
Default: 30

c:parameter.name: alarmSensitivityDeviceCount
c:parameter.description:
The number of alarm devices which must trigger before the alarm is fired.
Default: 1

c:parameter.name: silent
c:parameter.description:
Hub and keypad make sounds when arming.
Default: true

c:parameter.name: soundsEnabled
c:parameter.description: When true only notifications will be sent, alert devices will not be triggered.

c:parameter.name: activeDevices
c:parameter.description: The addresses of the devices that are participating in this alarm.

c:parameter.name: armedBy
c:parameter.description: The person arming the security alarm or empty if being armed via keypad or a rule

c:parameter.name: armedFrom
c:parameter.description: The address of the keypad, rule, scene, or app the security alarm was armed from.

c:return.name: securityArmTime
c:return.description: The time at which the security system will be armed.

c:error.description: If there are not enough devices for the given mode.

If there are devices currently tripped or offline that would otherwise participate. In this case the error description will be a comma separated list of devices that need to be bypassed in order to arm.
If the alarm is armed into a different mode or is currently in INACTIVE, PREALERT or CLEARING state. This means this call may be repeated while in ARMING or READY states.

c:method.name: Disarm
c:method.description: Attempts to disarm the security alarm. This MAY also cancel any incidents in progress.

c:parameter.name: disarmedBy
c:parameter.description: Address of the person that disarmed or cancelled the incident.

c:parameter.name: disarmedFrom
c:parameter.description: The address of the keypad, rule, scene, or app the security alarm was disarmed from.

c:method.name: ClearIncident
c:method.description: Issued by the platform when an incident has been fully canceled so the hub will clear out the current incident and related triggers.

c:event.name: Verified
c:event.description: Issued by alarm subsystem to the hub if a user verifies an alarm.
